title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a simple number guessing game:
1. Set a target number (e.g., 7)
2. Set a guess variable to 1
3. Use a while loop that runs while guess is not equal to target
4. Each time through the loop:
   - Display: 'Guess: [number] - Wrong!'
   - Increment guess by 1
5. After the loop, display: 'Guess: [number] - Correct!'
instructions:
Create a simple number guessing game:
1. Set a target number (e.g., 7)
2. Set a guess variable to 1
3. Use a while loop that runs while guess is not equal to target
4. Each time through the loop:
   - Display: 'Guess: [number] - Wrong!'
   - Increment guess by 1
5. After the loop, display: 'Guess: [number] - Correct!'

testCases.expectedOutput:
Guess: 1 - Wrong!
Guess: 2 - Wrong!
Guess: 3 - Correct!

hints.text: while (guess !== target) { console.log('Guess: ' + guess + ' - Wrong!'); guess++; }

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to update the condition variable
commonMistakes.consequence: The condition never becomes false, causing an infinite loop.
commonMistakes.correction: Always include code that changes the variable: guess++; inside the loop.

commonMistakes.consequence: Using guess-- when you need guess++ moves away from the target.
commonMistakes.correction: Ensure your update moves the variable toward making the condition false.

commonMistakes.consequence: Using !== vs < can cause the loop to skip over the target value.
commonMistakes.correction: Choose operators carefully: !== for exact match, < for ranges.
